intro: Pittonia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy pittonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Pittonia hirsuta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and seasonal blooms.
